programme.title: Jack Reacher
programme.desc: Investigator Jack Reacher leaps off the pages of Lee Child's novel and onto the big screen in this thriller. When a horrible crime is committed, all evidence points to the suspect in custody, who offers up a single note in defense: "Get Jack Reacher!"

programme.title: The Art of War

programme.title: The Art of War II: Betrayal

programme.title: The Art of War III: Retribution

programme.title: Jack Reacher
programme.desc: Investigator Jack Reacher leaps off the pages of Lee Child's novel and onto the big screen in this thriller. When a horrible crime is committed, all evidence points to the suspect in custody, who offers up a single note in defense: "Get Jack Reacher!"

programme.title: XXX

programme.title: Armored
programme.desc: A crew of officers at an armored transport security firm embark on the ultimate heist â€“ against their own company. The seemingly fool-proof plan soon proves to be useless when an unexpected witness interferes, as the plan quickly unravels.

programme.title: Jack Reacher
programme.desc: Investigator Jack Reacher leaps off the pages of Lee Child's novel and onto the big screen in this thriller. When a horrible crime is committed, all evidence points to the suspect in custody, who offers up a single note in defense: "Get Jack Reacher!"

programme.title: Einstein's Universe
programme.desc: A fascinating exploration of Einstein's theory of relativity told by narrator actor Peter Ustinov, and a cadre of preeminent scientists. Produced on the centennial of Einsteinâ€™s birth in 1979 by WGBH and BBC, based on Nigel Calderâ€™s titular book.

programme.title: Into the Cosmos: The Space Race, Mars and Beyond
programme.desc: Detailed accounts of previous missions for the exploration of Mars, including the landing of the rovers on the planets surface.

programme.title: Engineering Ground Breakers
programme.desc: The Burj Dubai holds the title as the tallest man-made structure ever built, pushing the technological envelope. Near India's capital Delhi, the Qutub Minar reigns supreme for almost a thousand years as the world's tallest brick minaret.

programme.title: Engineering Ground Breakers
programme.desc: On an island the size of Singapore, water scarcity is a dire issue. The solution is the construction of an urban reservoir, the first of its kind in the world. Together with cutting-edge technology, Singapore is on its way to water sufficiency.

programme.title: Engineering Ground Breakers: Episode 3
programme.desc: Tankers are the workhorses of our modern economy and the largest of these are built in Korea. Features like double-hulls and multiple tanks have pushed the cargo and safety capacity of tankers to new heights, making them the mainstay of the oil industry.

programme.title: Engineering Ground Breakers: Episode 4
programme.desc: For years, the roads of Mumbai were a hotbed of congestion and overcrowding. Now, a dynamic link road promises to ease the city's traffic woes, but the construction of Mumbai's first double-tiered flyover has been anything but easy.

programme.title: Engineering Ground Breakers: Episode 5
programme.desc: The largest airport terminal in the world in Beijing is an engineering marvel that nonetheless pays strict adherence to the principles of Chinese Feng shui, and marks a new footnote in an age-old tradition of building big.

programme.title: Engineering Ground Breakers: Episode 6
programme.desc: It is the world's deepest immersed Tunnel, the Marmaray Project promises to ease Istanbul's decades-old traffic woes. Located in an earthquake zone, it is an engineering feat that is only rivaled by the discovery of a nearby ancient port.

programme.title: Engineering Ground Breakers: Episode 7
programme.desc: Self-declared 8th Wonder of the World, the Palm trilogy is the largest man-made island chain in the world. Employing technology like satellite positioning, the Palm trilogy has broken new records and engineering milestones.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering
programme.desc: Discovering the transport networks of the past.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering
programme.desc: Without water, civilization is simply not possible; Romans took control of their water seriously.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering
programme.desc: How gold is mined and transformed into everyday objects like jewelry and currency.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering
programme.desc: Throughout history, ancestors have always strived to go higher, bigger, deeper, further.

programme.title: Naked Science
programme.desc: Naked Science investigates the violent cosmological forces that create planets and discover what it is that makes a planet a planet.

programme.title: Naked Science
programme.desc: 13.7 billion years ago there was absolutely nothing. No space, no time, and no matter. Naked Science follows the first three seconds of creation when a speck of light appeared from nothing and rapidly expanded into an enormous Universe.
programme.sub-title: The Big Bang - The First Three Seconds

programme.title: Naked Science
programme.desc: Hurricanes are one of the most destructive weather events to strike our planet and have the same power as a nuclear weapon.

programme.title: Naked Science
programme.desc: Naked Science follows the story of a diamond from the creation of carbon inside the heart of a dying sun, through to the cutting of a diamond mine in South Africa.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: The Inner Worlds
programme.desc: They orbit between our planet and our star. Mercury and Venus make up half of our terrestrial planets, but we still know very little about them. As we take a closer look at our companions, we find more questions than answers.

programme.title: Dateline NBC

programme.title: Dateline NBC

programme.title: Dateline NBC

programme.title: Dateline NBC

programme.title: Dateline NBC

programme.title: Dateline NBC

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Two old-fashioned dishes with modern appeal: Boston baked beans and chicken and dumplings. Neither requires fancy ingredients or expensive equipment, just a little time and effort.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: What's for Sunday dinner? Around many American tables, it's meat and potatoes. Beef brisket is a good choice and a nice change from pot roast or beef stew. Although inexpensive and simple to prepare, brisket does pose some challenges to the cook.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: There are certain dinners we rely on again and again. We are particularly fond of roasting chicken and potatoes together in one pan. While the chicken roasts, its juices drip onto the potatoes, giving them a wonderfully rich crust and creamy flavor.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We develop a foolproof preparation for pork chops with vinegar and peppersâ€”a modern version tangy and juicy enough to rival that prepared by an Italian grandmother. Next, we turn to pan-roasted pork tenderloin.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Tuna, which is often served rare to medium-rare, can be particularly tricky to get just right with a nicely seared crust. As for halibut, we developed a technique that ensured perfect texture without a loss of flavor.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Some people are intimidated by the thought of preparing fish. Traditional dishes, like Fish MeuniÃ¨re, can seem even more daunting. But you don't need to be wearing a toque to prepare this French classic well.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Most Italian recipes seem startlingly easy to prepare, requiring just a few simple ingredients. But some dishes need special care to reach their full potential. In this episode, we demystify two Italian classics: Fettuccine Alfredo and Beef in Barolo.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: In this episode, we prepare an Indian-inspired shrimp curry and a Thai-inspired green curry with chicken.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: When you eat chicken frequently, it pays to have a number of preparations on hand. In this episode, we turn to orange-flavored chicken and chicken teriyaki.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: One of our favorite Spanish dishes is paella. But with a lengthy ingredient list the shopping alone can give the home cook pause. We take a hard look at paella to see if we can pare back this dish to its humble origins without losing its alluring flavors.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We set out to develop a hassle-free pizza recipe especially for the grillâ€”one we hope will become a new backyard barbecue favorite.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Pork loin is delicious roasted in the oven, but it takes on a new character when cooked on the grill. The fire imparts a delicate smokiness to the meat, and the heat creates a handsome crust. French potato salad is a perfect counterpoint to the pork.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We wanted to develop a recipe for pulled pork that rivals that of the best barbecue joints but won't be an all-day affair. We pair the pork with another barbecue classicâ€”cornbread.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: If you're a fan of saucy barbecued chicken, you'll love pulled chicken. Similar to the more traditional pulled pork, it's simply tender shreds of smoky grilled chicken moistened with barbecue sauce.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Summer desserts are all about fruit. As inviting as a bowl of sweet berries can be, there's something about baked fruit desserts that we can't resist. In this episode we take a look at two summer favorites: blueberry cobbler and free-form fruit tart.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: With its impressive mounds of tender, juicy apples and melt-in-your-mouth pastry crust, deep-dish apple pie should take your breath away. Creating a pie with such a high volume of filling does, however, pose challenges.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: There seems to be a cookie to fit any occasion or mood. In this episode we look at two from opposite ends of the style spectrumâ€”the thick, homey oatmeal and the dainty, elegant spritz.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: In this episode, we aim to resurrect the traditional birthday cake. We've developed an honest-to-goodness layer cake with an old-fashioned jam filling and real butter frostingâ€”the type of cake guaranteed to put a smile on anyone's face.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: German chocolate cakeâ€”filled with sticky pecans and coconutâ€”is not without flaws. We set out to develop a German chocolate cake that avoids the common pitfalls and delivers on its promise.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We set out to make a meatloaf with well-seasoned meat and just enough binder to give the loaf a tender, not tough, texture. In choosing a side dish to partner with our meatloaf, we turned to another old-fashioned dishâ€”skillet-roasted potatoes.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Dinners prepared entirely in one skillet are perfect for weeknight cooking. Less cleanup is one obvious benefit. A skillet also gives the cook a bit more control over cooking multiple elements.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Beef, beer, and onions have a natural affinityâ€”it's one reason burgers and onion rings are often on bar menus. In a carbonnade, the beef melds with the soft sweetness of sliced onions in a lightly thickened broth that is rich, deep, and satisfying.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We wanted a streamlined version of roast chicken with plenty of stuffing to go around. First, we needed to solve the problem of cooking the stuffing to a safe temperature without drying out the delicate breast meat of the chicken.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Boneless pork chops are lean and quick-cooking, making them ideal for weeknight meals. Pork tenderloin, which is also lean, has a somewhat fussy reputation, but you don't need to be a professional chef to cook tenderloin properly.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We make a fresh-tasting, quick tamale pie with a juicy, spicy mixture of meat and vegetables and a quick homemade-cornbread topping. We also show you how to cook up a really flavorful chicken stew topped with a biscuit crust.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Whether we admit it or not, there are some dishes that are a little too high in fat and calories to be enjoyed on a regular basis. Even a modest portion of macaroni and cheese or chicken Parmesan is prohibitive. But that doesn't need to be the case.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We wanted to be able to serve English-style fish and chipsâ€”large pieces of moist and delicate cod in a crisp and tender coating with thick-cut friesâ€”at home.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Commonly found at catered events, this once-highbrow dish has become a bit of a joke. But after preparing several cookbook versions, we realized that pairing a crisp-fried coating with a delicate butter sauce was a great idea that deserved a revival.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: While the hallmark of this filet mignon is its tender texture, some argue that the beefy flavor is too mild, lacking the oomph of fattier cuts like rib eye. So we aim to boost the filet mignon's flavor with a peppercorn crust and a rich pan sauce.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We love a good stir-fry served with rice, but a noodle cake, a savory round of tender noodles sautÃ©ed in a skillet until the exterior is crisp, is also a great base for a saucy stir-fry.
programme.sub-title: Stir-Fried Chicken with Crispy Noodle Cake

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We prepare a Thai-inspired beef stir-fry and share a recipe for great potstickers.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We create tasty versions of two Tex-Mex favorites: chicken fajitas and huevos rancheros.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Just when we think we've become familiar with every Italian dish under the sun, we're pleasantly surprised to come across one we've somehow overlookedâ€”Spaghetti with Marinara Sauce.

programme.title: Rachel Getting Married
programme.desc: When Kym, returns to the Buchman family home for the wedding of her sister Rachel, she brings a long history of personal crises, family conflict, and tragedy along with her. Rated -R

programme.title: Room 237
programme.desc: Stanley Kubrick's classic film, 'The Shining,' gets a riveting and in-depth exploration of its hidden meanings, dazzling puzzles, and even conspiracy theories.

programme.title: Zola
programme.desc: A waitress, strikes up a friendship with a customer, who seduces her to join a weekend in Florida. What seems like a glamorous trip transforms into a journey involving a pimp, a boyfriend, gangsters and adventures in this see-it-to-believe-it tale.

programme.title: Memento
programme.desc: A man with short-term memory loss attempts to track down his wife's murderer.

programme.title: Hustle & Flow
programme.desc: The tale of DJay, a pimp whose hustle selling sexy Nola leaves him wondering if this is it for him. Only when he trades contraband for a keyboard and bumps into his old schoolfriend Key does he see a way out by laying down some tracks.

programme.title: Kiss the Girls
programme.desc: Eight kidnapped women. All beautiful. All talented. All in danger of having their lives cut cruelly short if police detective Alex Cross and key witness Kate McTiernan canâ€™t locate the elusive â€œcollectorâ€ who calls himself Casanova.

programme.title: The Man Standing Next: The Assassination of a President
programme.desc: The untold story of the Korean Central Intelligence Agency's political scheming in the 1970s is brought to vivid life in this powerfully acted drama.

programme.title: Ashfall
programme.desc: In the face of a disaster that will engulf both North and South Korea, a mission is put into action to stop a super volcanic eruption.

programme.title: Memories of the Sword
programme.desc: While in medieval Korea, a young girl sets out to revenge the betrayal and the death of her mother. But therefore she must face one of the most powerful men and warriors of the Goryo Dynasty.

programme.title: DIY SOS: The Big Build
programme.desc: Ryan has spent five years in a hospital, and now his house is in need of an extension with everything he needs, including a physio space, a wet-room, a family space, and the ability to access the whole ground floor.

programme.title: DIY SOS: The Big Build
programme.desc: Nick and the team return to a community for veterans to build the last home for Simon Flores and his children.

programme.title: DIY SOS: The Big Build
programme.desc: The team helps build a centre and supported housing for young people; stories from young people, as well as the founder of the Roots Foundation Wales.
programme.sub-title: The Million Pound Build for Children in Need

programme.title: DIY SOS: The Big Build
programme.desc: The team helps Amanda who needs her home to be wheelchair-friendly after being paralyzed in a cycling accident.

programme.title: DIY SOS: The Big Build
programme.desc: PC Kris Aves is left wheelchair-bound after being injured in a terrorist attack on March 22, 2017; his North London home is now inaccessible.

programme.title: DIY SOS: The Big Build
programme.desc: The team and West Bromwich volunteers help a grief-stricken family stuck in a tiny home.

programme.title: DIY SOS: The Big Build
programme.desc: The team constructs a new home for the Dale Youth Boxing Club.

programme.title: DIY SOS: The Big Build
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team attempt to build a two-story flexible-use center that can be used by the community.

programme.title: World's Weirdest Homes

programme.title: World's Weirdest Homes
programme.desc: From an eco-friendly spaceship to a dystopian Disneyland, Charlie Luxton visits more bizarre homes and meets their eccentric owners, from a Nigerian pop star to a 93-year-old monk.

programme.title: World's Most Luxurious
programme.desc: A look at top-end trains, such as South Africa's famous Blue Train, the Golden Eagle in Russia, and the Presidential Train in Portugal.

programme.title: World's Most Luxurious
programme.desc: Only the world's richest can possibly afford a super yacht, but it is not the price tag that makes these extravagant vessels exceptional, it is the luxurious details.

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Bakeation
programme.desc: Dave and Si journey through the Netherlands, where they bake lazybones buns beside a windmill.

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Bakeation
programme.desc: The guys travel from the wine region of the Rhine Valley to the spiritual home of beer, Bavaria, and discover Germany's passion for bread of every shape, size and flavor.

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Bakeation
programme.desc: The Hairy Bikers travel to the furthest corners of Europe, culminating in a fun family party thrown by Dave's Romanian wife, Lil.

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Bakeation
programme.desc: The bikers tour the home of Mozart and Arnold Schwarzenegger, starting in the patisserie capital of the world, Vienna.

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Bakeation
programme.desc: The bikers abandon their bikes in favor of gondolas and cook up focaccia, stromboli and eat a pasta pie on the back streets of Ferrara.

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Bakeation
programme.desc: In Lyon, Dave and Si explore the `bouchon', a restaurant normally run by a female chef.

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Bakeation
programme.desc: Dave and Si journey through Spain and visit a traditional Basque dining club in San SebastiÃ¡n.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: Rick visits Bologna in northern Italy, a city so famous for its food that it's known as the stomach of Italy. He learns how to make the local fresh egg pasta used for tortellini, tagliatelle, ravioli and lasagne.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: Rick Stein visits Lisbon on the banks of the River Tagus, a city in love with its seafood and possibly the best custard tarts in the world. The culinary effects of Portugal's historic explorations are still seen in its dishes.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: Rick visits the home of New Nordic cuisine, Copenhagen, where ground-breaking chefs create artful dishes and religiously stick to seasonal Danish ingredients. Rick goes foraging for rosehip and learns about the art of pickling buds, bark and flowers.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: Rick Stein heads to southern Spain and the historic city of Cadiz, where the narrow winding streets captivate him as he walks in the footsteps of the ancient Phoenician and Arab traders whose influence on the city can still be seen today.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: Rick visits the north-eastern Greek city of Thessaloniki.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: Rick Stein's long weekends across Europe come to a conclusion in the city of Palermo.

programme.desc: The guys ride into their hometown which is being over run by wild boars; the secret to cooking pig.

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers USA
programme.desc: Bill and Paul set out to hunt alligators using a crossbow; a beekeeper shows the guys the process of harvesting tupelo honey; redneck tailgate party, beer can chicken.

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers USA

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: An eclectic collection of homemade robots including Glitterbomb, designed by nine-year-old April, which comes complete with a huge pink axe. A team of students from Falkirk bring a robot made of wood with a petrol engine.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Former holiday camp bluecoats enter the competition with their `launcher' Apollo. Father and-son-team Kan-Opener have a robot with huge piercing claws. A team of engineering students have created a future tech machine called Sweeney Todd.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Featuring one of the most bizarre, but certainly the tallest robot ever seen on `Robot Wars', Gabriel, built by Mensa member Craig and his three sons. It has wheels as tall as a washing machine and a huge samurai sword.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Winner robots from rounds one through five battle it out in the arena, a wild card from the runners up throws a spanner in the works as it tries to overthrow attempts at glory.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: A new spinner has something to prove and a family team pour blood, sweat and tears into keeping their robot wars dream alive. The robots compete through brutal group battles and fierce head to heads for a place in the heat final.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The challenge for competitors is even tougher as the infamous House Robots have been let off the leash in a new twist. This is the second heat, and only one of the eight teams can go through to the series grand final.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Four teams progress into a mini league going head to head in a bid for points. The top two teams will face each other in the heat final for the chance to secure their place in this series' grand final.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: This fourth heat is an explosive display of spinners as old favourites take on new hopefuls. They must dodge the arena hazards and the menacing new twist as house robots are unleashed to attack competitors and inflict maximum damage.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The reigning champions Apollo mount their defence of the title. They face stiff competition from Ms Nightshade, Coyote, Rusty, Crackers'N'Smash, Meggamouse, Trolley Rage and Carbide.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: It is the grand final and the teams must dodge the arena hazards and, in a menacing new twist, they can also hit the Arena Tyre to unleash the dreaded House Robots, allowing them to inflict maximum damage anywhere in the arena.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The teams are Donald Thump, Behemoth, Sabretooth, Apollo, Apocalypse and The Swarm. Along the way they must dodge arena hazards, menacing house robots and the all-new Fog of War.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Returning champions Carbide mount their title defence against some of the toughest machines in the competition. They will have to fight through brutal group battles and nightmarish knockout rounds to make it to the heat final.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Learn more about this infamous Robot and the family that built it. With an unforgettable design and devastating weapon, the Hypno-Disc competitor became an instant icon.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Debuting in the Second Wars, to becoming the most successful Robot ever to take part in Robot Wars. The Razer Robot put the squeeze on all the competition, including the House Robots.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha brings the outdoors inside the home and shares her love of houseplants; she shows how to take care of the most popular houseplants and how to propagate them to create new plants.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha explores how to care for succulents including watering, fertilizing, and repotting.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha visits the Japanese restaurant Joji in the heart of New York, where Chef George Ruan shares his secrets for the ultimate omakase experience; culinary giant Daniel Boulud stops by.
programme.sub-title: Japanese Cuisine: Sushi, Sashimi and More

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha starts off brunch with a citrus cocktail Mary's knees; Chef Ignacio Mattos joins and makes an omelette with caviar and creme fraiche; Martha makes an endive salad; Martha makes waffles.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha journeys through her local area in search of the ultimate fresh-baked croissants and sourdough bread; learning about homemade bread and pastries.
programme.sub-title: How to Make Croissants and Sourdough Bread

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha is in the test kitchen with English chef, restaurateur, and author Jamie Oliver, and they're cooking up a mouth-watering menu of dishes that are easy to make.
programme.sub-title: One Pot Wonders With Jamie Oliver

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha and her niece Sophie visit their favorite tea shop, Arogya, in Westport, Conn., to discover the do's and don'ts of making tea; they return to Martha's kitchen to create dishes with tea.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha visits Mast Market in Mt. Kisco, N.Y., and learns the art behind making their renowned chocolate; from roasting cacao, to stone grinding, to forming delicious bars and chips.

programme.title: Martha Stewart Living
programme.desc: Sand sculptures; tools for making a sand castle; building a sandbox; easy chicken tacos and banana-blueberry swirl ice pops; an oilcloth cushion; homemade lip balm.
programme.sub-title: Taco Dinner; Banana-Blueberry Swirl Popsicles; Sandbox

programme.title: Martha Stewart Living
programme.desc: Decorating pool and patio; Newport, R.I., kite festival; lettuce; summer salad.
programme.sub-title: Lettuce Glossary; Outdoor Spaces; Instant Fruit Sorbet

programme.title: Martha Stewart Living
programme.desc: Coffee; red-eye gravy and grits; Southern smoke house; curing ham; antique toasters; fruit smoothies and granola.
programme.sub-title: Fried Eggs; The Perfect Cup of Coffee; Homemade Granola

programme.title: Martha Stewart Living
programme.desc: Frittatas; whole salmon and sauce; almond tart with strawberries.
programme.sub-title: The River Cafe Recipes: Whole Salmon, Almond Tart

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha takes us inside her vegetable greenhouse to see how she has turned her harvest into a year-round bounty; she collects, stores, and sows seeds, and makes her perfect green drink.
programme.sub-title: Inside Martha's Vegetable Greenhouse; Seed Starting

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha visits the incredible Orchid Show at the New York Botanical Garden; this year's show immerses you in a mesmerizing array of orchids designed by acclaimed artist Lily Kwong.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Now with over 200 chickens and 20 different breeds, Martha shares her vast knowledge about raising and caring for her flock; learn the how-tos of building a coop.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha builds a brand new, half-acre raised bed vegetable garden on her farm! It's a step-by-step guide to designing, building, preparing the soil, and planting.
programme.sub-title: Martha Builds a Raised Bed Vegetable Garden

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Everything is coming up roses on Martha's Bedford farm; Martha is creating a brand new rose garden with almost 200 roses; from color to fragrance, the inspired world of roses is a very good thing.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha's azalea grove is bursting with the last flowers of spring; then everything you need to know about hostas; Martha takes up bird watching.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: One of Martha's favorite things to do is to make jam with the perfectly ripened fruit and berries grown on her Bedford farm; Martha shares her favorite recipes, as well as jam and jarring techniques.
programme.sub-title: The Perfect Jams to Pair With a Simple Breakfast

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Meet Martha in one of her favorite places on the farm - the chicken coop to talk about one of her favorite things to eat - eggs; Martha will share her top methods for making an egg-cellent breakfast.
programme.sub-title: How to Properly Cook an Egg

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Tonight is pasta night in Bedford; Martha and friends make three pasta dishes, including a recipe from her new restaurant, The Bedford, a no-knife spaghetti, and a lemon angel hair pasta.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha takes shellfish to the next level with sustainable oysters, baked stuffed clams and more.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: From a pan seared steak with bordelaise sauce to a classic sizzling steak fired up on the grill, Martha makes steak dinners cooked to perfection with the help of her Head of Culinary at the farm.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha prepares pot-au-feu, a hearty french dish of root vegetables and various cuts of meat, all braised in a savory broth; It's served with sliced meat, vegetables and delicious accompaniments!
programme.sub-title: A Classic French Dish: Pot Au Feu

programme.title: Martha Cooks

programme.title: The Princess and the Pilot
programme.desc: In this anime tale, a top pilot must brave treacherous waters and death-defying danger to bring a princess to a royal palace.

programme.title: Yowamushi Pedal Re:RIDE
programme.desc: Experience the first season of Yowamushi Pedal in Re:RIDE, a compilation movie to get you pumped for Yowamushi Pedal Grande Road.

programme.title: Yowamushi Pedal Re:ROAD
programme.desc: Re:ROAD highlights the best of Yowamushi Pedal Grande Road in this non-stop compilation movie.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh! The Movie
programme.desc: Heroic Yugi squares off against archrival Kaiba in an adventure even more dangerous when the imaginary monsters in their playing cards become ferociously realâ€¦and when an old evil enters the fray.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh! Bonds Beyond Time
programme.desc: It's a whole new deal! For the first time, Yugi, Jaden & Yusei are together in an all-new adventure!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh! The Dark Side of Dimensions
programme.desc: The stakes have never been higher, the rivalries never as fierce, the risks never so great. One wrong move - one card short - and it's game over for good.

programme.title: A Wind Named Amnesia
programme.desc: In this anime classic, a powerful wind has left all memories erased. Two years later, a young man travels on a journey to find the truth about the apocalyptic wind.

programme.title: Naruto Shippuden: The Movie
programme.desc: A long time ago, a powerful spirit drove the world to the brink of destruction. Naruto's latest mission is to protect Shion, a priestess from the Land of Ogres, whom the spirit is after.

programme.title: Naruto Shippuden the Movie: Bonds
programme.desc: Mysterious flying ninja have launched a sudden attack against the Leaf. To save their village, Naruto and his friends set out to stop this new threat.

programme.title: Project A-Ko
programme.desc: Superhuman high schooler, A-ko, must set aside her rivalry with her genius classmate, B-ko, to save earth from evil alien invaders.

programme.title: Bottle Shock
programme.desc: The story of the early days of California wine making featuring the now infamous, blind Paris wine tasting of 1976 that has come to be known as "Judgment of Paris". Feat: Chris Pine, Alan Rickman & Bill Pullman.

programme.title: The Last Legion
programme.desc: As the Roman empire collapses, young Romulus Augustus must leave the city and set out for a dangerous journey to Britain to locate his last legion of supporters.

programme.title: Legendary
programme.desc: Cal Chetley is a bright, engaging, undersized fifteen year-old who's been picked on most of his life. Cal joins his high school wrestling team in the hopes his brother will train him. More importantly, Cal uses wrestling as the tool to reunite his family.

programme.title: Big Momma's House
programme.desc: In order to protect a woman from a robber, a male FBI agent disguises himself as an elderly woman.

programme.title: Prince Valiant
programme.desc: In a time now lost in the mists of memory, the great King Arthur rules in the legendary citadel that is Camelot. Starring: Joanna Lumley, Stephen Moyer, Katherine Heigl, Thomas Kretschmann

programme.title: Out of the Furnace
programme.desc: When Rodney Baze mysteriously disappears and law enforcement doesn't follow through fast enough, his older brother Russell takes matters into his own hands to find justice.

programme.title: A Haunted House
programme.desc: When Malcolmâ€™s (Marlon Wayans) girlfriend moves into his house, he soon discovers the love of his life is possessed by an evil spirit. Malcolm enlists the help of Father Williams (Cedric the Entertainer) to exorcise the demon from his girlfriend.

programme.title: The Last Legion
programme.desc: As the Roman empire collapses, young Romulus Augustus must leave the city and set out for a dangerous journey to Britain to locate his last legion of supporters.

programme.title: The Negotiator
programme.desc: The tables turn when a seasoned hostage negotiator takes hostages and risks all to prove his own innocence.

programme.title: In Time
programme.desc: Justin Timberlake and Amanda Seyfried co-star in this sci-fi thriller set in a future world where aging stops at 25, and the only way for one man to stay alive is to steal more time.

programme.title: Cadia: The World Within
programme.desc: Devastated by the loss of their mother, three teens discover a mystical realm ruled by unseen forces and must overcome evil in the order to return home.

programme.title: Bogus
programme.desc: When 7-year-old Albert's mother is suddenly killed in an auto accident, he and his imaginary French friend "Bogus" take up residence with his no-nonsense aunt Harriet.

programme.title: A Fairy Tale After All
programme.desc: A teenage girl is transported into a world of fantasy and fairy tales while at a school marionette show. She realizes her own imagination has an adventure already scripted for her that carries more wisdom than she could ever find in the real world.

programme.title: The Amazing Fox
programme.desc: Ten-year-old Amanda desperately wants a dog but her Dad won't let her. When she finds a young fox, she and her friend Maggie conspire to keep it as a pet. Can Amanda and Maggie outfox the adults?

programme.title: First Daughter
programme.desc: Samantha Mackenzie wants what every college freshman desires: to experience life away from home and parents. It's not going to be easy, however, because home for Sam is the White House, and her dad is the President of the United States.

programme.title: Firehouse Dog
programme.desc: Hollywood's most pampered pooch gets lost during a commercial shoot and ends up as the mascot for a local fire station.

programme.title: Labyrinth
programme.desc: Sixteen-year-old Sarah must solve a labyrinth to rescue her baby brother when he is taken by the Goblin King.

programme.title: The Wind in the Willows - Original Movie
programme.desc: Toad, Rat, Mole and Badger follow animal etiquette in this version of Kenneth Grahame's classic, in stop-motion model animation.

programme.title: The BFG: The Original Movie
programme.desc: A young orphan girl, Sophie, gets taken away to a faraway land populated by Giants and Dreams.

programme.title: The Simple Life of Noah Dearborn
programme.desc: Academy Award winners Sidney Poitier and Dianne Wiest star with Mary-Louise Parker in this enchanting tale about a quiet hero who becomes the talk of the town.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Greed, Ego & Jealousy
programme.desc: After watching the Christina catch the biggest tuna of the season, the uber-competitive Captain Dave of the Tuna.com is obsessed with beating the record, and catching a fish bigger than 1,075 lbs!

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Mann gegen Sturm
programme.desc: Marciano, captain of Hard Merchandise, risks the elements to hook a giant bluefin and finds himself with boat trouble in the midst of the storm.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Mutiny at Sea
programme.desc: A mixture of bad luck and mutiny brews in this tumultuous episode of Wicked Tuna. Tensions erupt on New England's top tuna boat, Tuna.Com, when Captain Dave and Paul get into a heated confrontation that causes Paul to quit!

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Grudge Match
programme.desc: With just two weeks left until the end of tuna fishing season, Bounty Hunter gains a new deckhand.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Captain Ralph in Not
programme.desc: A hard season with little money to show has taken its toll on the crew of the Odysea, leading Captain Ralph to lash out at his first mate Pirate.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Good to the Last Bite
programme.desc: As the final week of tuna fishing begins, the Hard Merchandise, the Bounty Hunter, the Tuna.Com and the Odysea steam out together, each captain vowing to catch the biggest tuna before the season ends.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: The Bite is On
programme.desc: Meet the fleet, as peak season begins and the adrenaline rush of \\"monstah\\" hunting hits Gloucester.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Payback's a Fish
programme.desc: After going bust on his last trip and coming home empty-handed, Marciano of Hard Merchandise now wrestles with the trials of being a husband and father who has to be away from home so often.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Weekend Warriors
programme.desc: Tuna.com continues its winning streak, catching two fish in one day while the rest of the fleet struggles to even find a spot to fish in between the weekend recreational boaters.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Size Matters
programme.desc: Meet Kevin and the Christina, a boat that gets its own real-life fish story when it snags an 1,100-pound \\"monstah\\" right out of the gate.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Greed, Ego & Jealousy
programme.desc: After watching the Christina catch the biggest tuna of the season, the uber-competitive Captain Dave of the Tuna.com is obsessed with beating the record, and catching a fish bigger than 1,075 lbs!

programme.desc: As the final week of tuna fishing begins, the Hard Merchandise, the Bounty Hunter, the Tuna.Com and the Odysea steam out together, each captain vowing to catch the biggest tuna before the season ends.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Back In The Hunt
programme.desc: The fishermen of Gloucester, Massachusetts, head for open seas in hopes of catching the first fish of the Atlantic Bluefin Tuna Season.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Go Fish!
programme.desc: The fishermen of Gloucester, Massachusetts, battle for the elusive and lucrative giant Bluefin tuna, with harpooners going up against rod-and-reelers.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: The Numbers War
programme.desc: The fishermen of Gloucester battle for prime fishing spots in their quest to catch the elusive and lucrative Bluefin Tuna.

programme.title: Replicas
programme.desc: A scientist becomes obsessed with bringing back his family members who died in a traffic accident.

programme.title: Heist
programme.desc: A father is without the means to pay for his daughter's medical treatment. As a last resort, he partners with a greedy co-worker to rob a casino. When things go awry they're forced to hijack a city bus.

programme.title: Atomic Twister
programme.desc: When tornadoes hit a nuclear power plant, the results could be catastrophic. "Atomic Twister" traces an extraordinary day in the lives of small-town citizens who unexpectedly find themselves facing the possibility of mass destruction.

programme.title: Kill Command
programme.desc: An elite Marines unit must fight to survive when they are helicoptered to an off-the-grid training facility.

programme.title: Replicas
programme.desc: A scientist becomes obsessed with bringing back his family members who died in a traffic accident.

programme.title: Heist
programme.desc: A father is without the means to pay for his daughter's medical treatment. As a last resort, he partners with a greedy co-worker to rob a casino. When things go awry they're forced to hijack a city bus.

programme.title: Point Break
programme.desc: An F.B.I. Agent goes undercover to catch a gang of surfers who may be bank robbers.

programme.title: Point Blank
programme.desc: Mickey Rourke and Danny Trejo star in this action-packed drama about a gang of psychotic criminals who break out of prison and take control of a Texas shopping mall.

programme.title: Point Break
programme.desc: An F.B.I. Agent goes undercover to catch a gang of surfers who may be bank robbers.

programme.title: Meet the Spartans
programme.desc: From the creators of Date Movie comes this tongue-in-cheek parody of the sword-and-sandal epics, dubbed MEET THE SPARTANS.

programme.title: Dotty & Soul
programme.desc: When a social media scandal threatens entrepreneur Ethan Cox's company acquisition, he hires 71-year-old snack cart vendor, Dotty, as a figurehead. But when Dotty embraces her role and refuses to be a puppet, Ethan's plans are challenged.

programme.title: Brad's Status
programme.desc: A father takes his son to tour colleges on the East Coast and meets up with an old friend who makes him feel inferior about his life's choices.

programme.title: Meet the Spartans
programme.desc: From the creators of Date Movie comes this tongue-in-cheek parody of the sword-and-sandal epics, dubbed MEET THE SPARTANS.

programme.title: Dotty & Soul
programme.desc: When a social media scandal threatens entrepreneur Ethan Cox's company acquisition, he hires 71-year-old snack cart vendor, Dotty, as a figurehead. But when Dotty embraces her role and refuses to be a puppet, Ethan's plans are challenged.

programme.title: Brad's Status
programme.desc: A father takes his son to tour colleges on the East Coast and meets up with an old friend who makes him feel inferior about his life's choices.

programme.title: Meet the Spartans
programme.desc: From the creators of Date Movie comes this tongue-in-cheek parody of the sword-and-sandal epics, dubbed MEET THE SPARTANS.

programme.title: That Awkward Moment
programme.desc: Three best friends find themselves where we've all been - at that confusing moment in every dating relationship when you have to decide "So...where is this going?"

programme.title: The Little Hours
programme.desc: In the Middle Ages, a young servant fleeing from his master takes refuge at a convent full of emotionally unstable nuns. Introduced as a deaf mute man, he must fight to hold his cover as the nuns try to resist temptation.

programme.title: That Awkward Moment
programme.desc: Three best friends find themselves where we've all been - at that confusing moment in every dating relationship when you have to decide "So...where is this going?"

programme.title: All of My Heart
programme.desc: A young catererâ€™s life suddenly changes course when she inherits a country home and learns she must share it with a career-obsessed Wall Street trader. At first, these opposites do not attract...

programme.title: The Wedding Veil Expectations
programme.desc: Avery and Peter try to keep the romance alive while renovating an old house and juggling work, but everything takes on a new perspective when Avery has a surprise for Peter.

programme.title: The Love Club: Lauren
programme.desc: Lauren dreams of opening an art gallery while dealing with her mixed emotions about her husband. She recruits The Love Club to help her move on, but instead they come up with a plan to keep them together.

programme.title: Unexpected Grace
programme.desc: When lonely young Grace finds a note from a schoolgirl looking for a friend, she excitedly writes back, setting off a chain of events that ultimately changes the lives of three people.

programme.title: Flower Shop Mystery: Dearly Depotted
programme.desc: Abby Knight, ex-lawyer, crime buff and owner of Bloomers Flower Shop, is having a week to be reckoned with. A reluctant bridesmaid at wedding, Abby ends up not just doing the flowers, but having to solve a murder.

programme.title: 10 Truths About Love
programme.desc: A thriving romance columnist thinks she has her love life figured out, until her long-time boyfriend breaks up with her. At the same time, her editor hires a new writer to collaborate on her column, and sparks begin to fly as they clash.

programme.title: Marrying Mr. Darcy
programme.desc: Elizabeth, a down to earth school teacher and Donovan, a reserved New York businessman, are very different. Which means their engagement and wedding is nothing if unpredictable.

programme.title: Love Under the Rainbow
programme.desc: Lucy wasn't sure if she would find true love, until Jack moves to town with his daughter Sophie. Together they teach her it's never too late to start chasing rainbows!

programme.title: June In January
programme.desc: Wealthy Alex and blue-collar June are madly in love but get their wires crossed while racing down the aisle. June's been preparing for a very specific kind of wedding her whole life.

programme.title: Love's Portrait
programme.desc: Museum curator, Lily, finds a painting that's identical to her and searches for the artist in Ireland. There, William, a charming man joins her on her quest and helps her rediscover love.

programme.title: Make Me A Match
programme.desc: Vivi enlists the help of an Indian Matchmaker, Raina, to change her fate in love. However, Raina's son Bhumesh just might be the change Vivi needed all along.

programme.title: Debbie Macomber's A Mrs. Miracle Christmas
programme.desc: When a family faces loneliness and loss of faith, Mrs. Miracle swoops in to renew their Christmas Spirit, and they experience a holiday of heavenly proportions.

programme.title: A Family Christmas Gift
programme.desc: When Amber spends the holidays with her Aunt Dora and helps plan a fundraising Christmas Concert, it brings Amber closer to her aunt and a new love into her life.

programme.title: Majestic Christmas
programme.desc: Christmas in the charming town of Briar Falls will be bittersweet this year when architect Nell goes back to her hometown having been given the job of turning the historic Majestic Playhouse into a modern multiplex.

programme.title: Swept Up By Christmas
programme.desc: An antique seller and a cleaner clash over how to downsize a magnificent estate right before Christmas.

programme.title: Open By Christmas
programme.desc: When Nicky finds an unopened Christmas card from a high school secret admirer, she and her best friend Simone search to find and thank the anonymous author.

programme.title: Mistletoe & Menorahs
programme.desc: When a toy company executive must learn about Hanukkah to land a big account, she enlists the help of her co-worker's friend, who also happens to be in need of turning his pad into a Christmas Wonderland.

programme.title: Five More Minutes: Moments Like These
programme.desc: Inspired by Scotty McCreery's song 'Five More Minutes', a Christmas wish gets realized in an unexpected way, as a young widow has to return to her old home for the holidays.

programme.title: Candy Cane Christmas
programme.desc: As Phoebe is searching for a new tradition to lift her holiday spirits, she realizes that it's not the traditions we cherish, but the people with whom we share them.

programme.title: Angel Falls: A Novel Holiday
programme.desc: Book editor Hannah must work with former rival Ryan to help a potential writer find her way. Angel Anthony reminds them about Christmas spirit and the value of community.

programme.title: Our Christmas Journey
programme.desc: As a single mom and her teenage son with autism come to a crossroad during Christmas, she must learn to let go so he can flourish as she finds her own heart healing in unexpected ways.

programme.title: Monty Python: Almost The Truth
programme.desc: Comedic team Monty Python document arriving in the U. S. and leaving TV to dive headfirst into film. The ups and downs with their project Monty Python and the Holy Grail.

programme.title: Monty Python's Best Bits (Mostly)
programme.desc: Working Class Playright (Dara O Briain), Self Defence Against Fresh Fruit (Simon Pegg), Nudge Nudge (Charlie Higson), Communist Quiz (Paul Whitehouse), How Not To Be Seen (Seth Green)

programme.title: Monty Python's Best Bits (Mostly)
programme.desc: Vocational Guidance Counsellor, The Albatross, The Lumberjack Song, How To Recognise Trees: No. 1: The Larch, Musical Mice, The Restaurant

programme.title: Monty Python's Flying Circus
programme.desc: It's Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart', Famous Deaths, Italian Lesson, Whizzo Butter, 'It's the Arts', Arthur "Two-Sheds" Jackson, Cycling Race, and The Funniest Joke in the World.

programme.title: Monty Python's Flying Circus
programme.desc: Flying Sheep, French Lecture on Sheep-Aircraft, A Man With Three Buttocks, A Man With Two Noses, Musical Mice, Marriage Guidance Counselor, The Wacky Queen, Working-Class Playwright, A Scotsman on a Horse, The Wrestling Epilogue, and The Mouse Problem.

programme.title: Monty Python's Flying Circus
programme.desc: Court Scene, The Larch, Bicycle Repair Man, Children's Stories, Restaurant Sketch, Seduced Milkmen, Stolen News Reader, Children's Interview, and Nudge Nudge.
programme.sub-title: How To Recognise Different Types Of Trees From Quite A Long Way Away

programme.title: Monty Python's Flying Circus
programme.desc: A change from street clothes to swim trunks turns into a burlesque act; a karate class exercises defense tactics against fresh fruit; a man tries to buy a book about false teeth.

programme.title: Monty Python's Flying Circus
programme.desc: Confuse-a-Cat, The Smuggler, A Duck, a Cat and a Lizard, Vox Pops on Smuggling, Police Raid, Letters on Vox Pops, Newsreader Arrested, Erotic Film, Cartoon - Charles Fatless, Silly Job Interview, Careers Advisory Board, Burglar/Encyclopaedia Salesman
programme.sub-title: Man's Crisis Of Identity In The Latter Half Of The 20th Century

programme.title: Monty Python's Flying Circus
programme.desc: Sketches include: a German composer with an extraordinarily long name; crooks plan an elaborate scheme to buy a watch; a chocolate-company owner markets "Crunchy Frog."
programme.sub-title: It's The Arts / The BBC Entry For The Zinc Stoat Of Budapest

programme.title: Monty Python's Flying Circus
programme.desc: Invaders from another galaxy turn Englishmen into Scotsmen. Also: a comedy about camels; a corporate board meeting.

programme.title: Monty Python and the Holy Grail
programme.desc: Grossing the highest box-office of any British film in the US when released in 1975, this "cult classic" comedy from the Monty Python team loosely follows the legend of King Arthur, along with his squire and his Knights of the Round Table.

programme.title: The Command

programme.title: The Fifth Estate
programme.desc: The top-notch team of hosts Bob McKeown, Gillian Findlay, Mark Kelley and Habiba Nosheen provides unique and engaging documentaries from Canada and beyond. "The Fifth Estate" is a reference to the term Fourth Estate, and was chosen to highlight the program's determination to go beyond everyday news into original journalism. The series has won numerous awards for its reporting, including Gemini Awards, International Emmys, the Michener Award, and even an Academy Award for a 1981 episode that was released in theaters the following year. Since September 1975, Canadians have tuned in to experience interesting stories that are always well-crafted and thought-provoking.

programme.title: Marketplace
programme.desc: Canada's consumer watchdog series since 1972, this news program uncovers wrongdoings in the marketplace. With the help of hidden cameras, correspondents dish out the dirt on not so "clean" business practices. Once they get the evidence they need on tape, they apply pressure on businesses to change policies vis-a-vis the products and services they provide to the public.

programme.title: Wild Bavaria
programme.desc: The moon disappears behind the horizon and the stage is set for a new day in the Alps of Berchtesgaden.

programme.title: Wild Bavaria
programme.sub-title: Wild Bavaria - In The Shadow of the Watzmann.
programme.desc: Mighty and mysterious, King Watzmann sits above Germany's only alpine national park.

programme.title: Bavaria's Alpine Kingdom
programme.desc: There are sparkling palaces from ice and snow, like those found in a fairytale. The icy castles are the phenomenal work of Mother Nature but man had a hand in the magnificent stone castles of the region. The spectacular and histrionic mountains of the Bavarian Alps challenge wildlife and the people who live there and the rocky ramparts of this mountain kingdom are built of limestone and fossil rocks that tell of its origins beneath the sea. Millions of visitors from all over the world come to Bavaria every year to witness the mysticism of the landscape. Kings and Queens, tourist and locals, all are welcomed in the fantastic alpine kingdom. Early summer often comes with the threat of storms that bring floods that scour the land and threaten many creatures. But farmers risk these dangers to take their herds to the highest pastures, where they can graze on the sweetest flower-filled meadows. And later from the high-quality milk produced by their herds, the famers make highly prized cheese. Humankind lives among eagle owls, chamoix, wild cats, stoats and ravens up in these mountains.

programme.title: Treasure of Lima - Buried Exhibition
programme.desc: This is a story about a remote island in the pacific.

programme.title: Bosnia Herzegovina
programme.desc: Wild and unknown lies the still undiscovered natural paradise of Bosnia and Herzegovina in the heart of Europe. Rough mountains, dense forests and wild waterfalls characterize the picture of the untouched landscapes. Lynx, wolves and bears roam mountains and valleys. One of the last primeval forests in Europe is a retreat for many endangered animal species. Bosnia and Herzegovina is actually an undiscovered natural paradise in the middle of Europe.

programme.title: Bosnia Herzegovina
programme.desc: The barren, karstic south of the country, Herzegovina, also impresses with its natural landscapes. One of them is the Livno field. Not only is it the largest wetland in the country, it is also the largest regularly flooded karst field in the world. About 700 wild horses live in this unique landscape. Their ancestors were working horses that were abandoned here more than 50 years ago. Another special feature of the karst landscape are the rivers with their tufa barriers. The countless waterfalls that pour over it are a unique natural phenomenon.

programme.title: Wilderness in Europe: The Bohemian Forest
programme.sub-title: The Psychogramm of a Spiritual Landscape
programme.desc: The Bohemian Forest is the source of the Vltava River, home to primeval forests, untouched high moors and bubbling torrents. This archaic stretch of land, which includes the Bavarian Forest, was long considered impenetrable and mysterious. Since the fall of the Iron Curtain, Bavarian border residents have rediscovered new references to this unusual forest landscape for themselves. This is also the case with photo artist Bastian Kalous, who has been documenting his homeland for years with nostalgic-looking Polaroid photographs and is dealing with its eventful history for an illustrated book. Or Elisa Belotti and Marco Heurich, who have dedicated their lives to the lynxes. In order for Europe's largest wild cat to survive in the Bohemian Forest, the lynx researchers fight for every single animal. Iryna Rudenko came to Zwiesel from Ukraine out of a passion for glass as a material to study at the glass school. After graduation, she would like to stay in Bavaria, Anna Hones grew up in HorskÃ¡ Kvilda, the smallest and highest village in the Czech Republic. The village lies just under 1100 meters above sea level, directly on the former border. The farmer, who experienced communism, the fall of the Iron Curtain and the subsequent changes, is now trying to find ways of surviving in this barren region with her children.

programme.title: Wilderness in Europe: The Bohemian Forest
programme.desc: Pavel Hubeny, whose life would be unthinkable without the forest, is the head of the Å umava National Park. He is committed to ensuring that a primeval forest can grow for future generations, in which man does not interfere. This vision of a primeval forest is also shared by the forester Claus BÃ¤ssler, who wants to counteract the extinction of species by having trees felled to create artificial deadwood and thus a new habitat for rare beetles and fungi. On the Vltava River lies the small town of Krumlov, the "Pearl of the Bohemian Forest" with its Baroque theater and fully preserved stage technology from the 17th century. Here the director Zuzana VrbovÃ¡ enchants people from all over the world with her productions. Apart from agriculture, it was mainly the abundance of forests that ensured the livelihood of the inhabitants of the Bohemian Forest - including that of the carpenter Philipp von Manz, who processed local wood for his customers all over Germany. Veterinarian Judith Gollner, who grew up in the Austrian part of the Bohemian Forest, lived in Vienna for a long time and made a conscious decision to return. She likes the people and is proud of "her farmers' wives" who share her love of the Bohemian Forest.

programme.title: Wild River Rhine
programme.desc: Alluvial forests, roaring waterfalls, steep canyons and sunny slopes flank the river Rhine. The variety of habitats is the reason for the large biodiversity along the stream.There is hardly any other river in Germany that is surrounded by as many myths and legends as the river Rhine. No other river has been the topic of songs, has been painted and travelled equally frequently. Despite this it still seems to be true today what the French poet Victor Hugo once said about this river â€“ the Rhine is a river everybody talks about, nobody explores, everybody visits but no one really knows. The film follows the water against the stream. It starts at the riverâ€™s delta in the Netherlands, flows through six countries and ends in the Swiss Alps.

programme.title: Over the Islands of Africa
programme.sub-title: Over the Islands of Africa, Zanzibar
programme.desc: Photographer Matthias Ziegler is an Africa specialist. He has visited nearly every country on the continent on assignments for international agencies. Zanzibar, however, is new territory for him. He's come to the former slave island for a photo book â€“ and this time he's not alone. To see the Tanzanian archipelago from the air, he has enlisted the services of ultralight pilot Richard Meredith-Hardy of England to fly him around in his FIB, or flying inflatable boat. Perfect conditions for an adventurous journey: as a world champion ultralight pilot, Richard and his FIB can take off and land practically anywhere â€“ in theory.

programme.title: Over the Islands of Africa
programme.sub-title: Over the Islands of Africa, Mauritius
programme.desc: Renaud Van Der Meeren is a photographer and paramotor pilot. With his motorised parachute he goes on expeditions to the remotest corners on earth to photograph people and landscapes from the air. Renaud wanted to be a jet pilot, studied music at the Sorbonne, became a ski instructor, model and photographer's assistant before he found happiness in his current vocation. He especially likes to do his job in Mauritius â€“ nowhere else does he find so many motifs as on the "sweetest pearl in the Indian Ocean". This time he's working on a photo book about Mauritius â€“ by land, by water and in the air.

programme.title: Over the Islands of Africa
programme.sub-title: Over the Islands of Africa, Madagascar
programme.desc: Spirits, Kings, Lemurs â€“ Madagascar treats Ami to a multitude of new impressions and spectacular pictures. Director Christian Schidlowski and his team accompanied her on her trip.

programme.title: Over the Islands of Africa
programme.sub-title: Over the Islands of Africa, Sao Tome and Principe
programme.desc: Along with photographer Rui Camilo, we travel to the West African island nation of Sao TomÃ© and PrÃ­ncipe - in search of images that will capture the soul of this small and beautiful country.

programme.title: Over the Islands of Africa
programme.sub-title: Over the Islands of Africa, Cape Verde
programme.desc: Cape Verde â€“ the islands of Saudade, of longing. For StÃ©phane and Richard it was a journey full of adventure, unforgettable encounters and magnificent photographs. Director Christian Schidlowski and his team accompanied them on their trip.

programme.title: Wild Moments
programme.sub-title: Wild Moments: Four Seasons - Spring & Summer
programme.desc: In accordance with the seasons and with deep respect of nature, people all over the world celebrate their long-standing traditions. In Japan the first picnics at the cherry blossom festival kick off the long-awaited outdoor season, while the Scots perform their Highland Games. In the summer the Latvians celebrate the biggest party of the year: midsummer night. The vast wildflower meadows provide them with wreathes of flowers which have magical healing powers; animals are provided with an abundance of insects. This enables the rare hoopoe to breed in Latvia. In the Spree forest region, an enchanting river landscape south-east of Berlin, farmers still harvest the famous Spreeforest Cucumber. "Four seasons - Many traditions" is a visual journey around the globe meeting people who are passionate and dedicated at keeping old traditions alive.

programme.title: Wild Moments
programme.desc: In accordance with the seasons and with deep respect of nature, people all over the world celebrate their long-standing traditions. Near the outermost border of Europe, in Bashkiria, generations of bee keepers have collected honey from rare wild bees, the Burzyan bees. In Japan the last of the Usho catch fish with "living fishing rods": trained cormorants. Traditionally, they provided the Emperor's family with fresh fish. In Poland carp are fished from the ponds to provide everybody with carp for Christmas dinner - this is an old Polish tradition. In Frisia winter is driven out by fires at what is known as "Biikebrennen", and in Hungary the "Busho" - frightening characters wearing wooden masks - do a similar job. "Four seasons - Many traditions" is a journey, meeting people who are passionate at keeping old traditions alive.

programme.title: Wild Moments
programme.desc: Wildlife filmmakers experience many emotionally touching moments on their expeditions while observing their main characters over a longer period of time. A lucky moment for Oliver Goetzl and Ivo NÃ¶renberg in the Yellowstone National Park: When a wolf appears they give up on a lone newborn bison. But at the very last moment, its mother arrives and saves it. On an expedition in the Himalayas, Henry Mix is able to find Bengal tigers. A kangaroo mother even allows Thoralf Grospitz to film its tiny baby in her pouch. But they witness sad moments as well: On the Arctic Wrangel Island, Uwe Anders has to watch a snowy owl mother stop feeding one of her two chicks due to the shortage of food that year. "Big emotions" shows the most touching and the most heart-breaking moments wildlife filmmakers have experienced all over the world.

programme.title: Wild Moments
programme.desc: As an animal filmmaker, one often deals with lots of strange old birds. No wonder, that so much can go wrong. After a long day of filming, a surprise awaits at the camp: Wolves have been looking for chocolate biscuits! Yet these are not the only things that can happen in the Arctic. Yann Sochaczewski is out and about in the magnificent Grand Canyon. On his raft on the Colorado River, he risks life and limb in doing so. In Australia, Thoralf Grospitz and Jens Westphalen play cat and mouse with an odd bird, that turns out to be a real entertainer. In the Serengeti, Reinhard Radke despairs of the many tourists who constantly walk in front of his lens. Wildlife filmmakers travel around the world for these very encounters. They bring nature into our living rooms, experience the beautiful, the saddest and the most poignant moments. And many funny ones.

programme.title: Wild Moments
programme.desc: When humans and wild animals live next door to one another, things can sometimes be a little hairy. Some organise themselves in impertinent gangs, others mutually cultivate their own friendships. In New Zealand, keas organise themselves into gangs and obviously have it in for all the rubber seals belonging to winter sports enthusiasts. Their motto: nibble all you can. In Australia, Klaus WeiÃŸmann and Rolf Sziringer struggle with a huge invasion. Thousands of flies have taken a liking to the two men. This causes frayed nerves. And in Zambia, Jens Westphalen and Thoralf Grospitz capture a veritable display of elephants with the camera. Every year, their fine noses lead them into a hotel garden - in which the fruits on the wild mango tree are ripe. But, there is a catch: To get to their picnic, they have to walk through the lobby. This is what happens when buildings are erected around even older premises.

programme.title: Wild Moments
programme.desc: Nature has many weird creatures to offer and often these animals fascinate us the most. There are ants in Australia's outback that use specialised workers as living honey pots. In Africa in the endless Bangweulu wetlands of Zambia the shoebill is on the hunt for fish, a bird that definitely lives up to its name. Finally in the Brazilian rainforests lurk gruesome river monsters in the Amazon abyss that send shivers down the spine of even the most experienced divers. But there are also intense human-animal-relationships like the close bond between a German diver and a dolphin female who explore the Atlantic off the coast of Ireland, or the "easy rider" in California who has taken care of an African elephant bull for more than 25 years. Weird! is a breathtaking journey to visit animals around the globe who are somehow different.

programme.title: Crazy Creature Costumes
programme.desc: Animals shock us with the most bizarre appearances - some even look like they've been dressing up. But the weird and wonderful shapes and colours of nature are vital to the animals' lives. Sometimes they're disguised to help blend in, other times they are designed to stand out and show off. But whether it's a monkey in make-up or a salamander's toxic stripes, the weird and wonderful outfits enable the creature to thrive.

programme.title: The Dying King
programme.desc: In the open wilderness of Africa, there are only 20.000 lions living a free life. In the last decade, humans have killed hundreds of thousandsâ€“ mostly for purely hunting purposes. In the last couple of years, a new industry has developed called the canned hunting, where animals are bred for 4-5 years then released into a confined area. This confined area is created for the sole purpose optimizing the odds of the hunter obtaining a kill. The corpse of the dead, often male, lion is thereby treated as a trophy. Tourists pay up to 40, 000 USD for this 'privilege'.

programme.title: Masai Mara: The Big Hunt
programme.desc: When food supply in the Serengeti dwindles, the Masai Mara is a paradise for predators. As the black wildebeests, gazelles, zebras and antelopes make their yearly trip from the south of the Serengeti to the north, natureâ€™s best laid trap, the Mara River in Kenya is waiting ahead. Captivating shots filmed under water show how crocodiles prepare for the Big Hunt while other predators lurk on the banks awaiting their bounty. The biggest problems for the migratory animals are the Mara and the Tarek River, where they have to put their lives at risk to get to the other side. A great number of them die as they jump into the river and break their legs, while others are carried away by the drift or drown. Those who are not victims of the river itself risk falling prey to the crocodiles. We entered this unchartered territory, the crocodile domain by heading under water. Follow these predators in and around their habitat and watch prides of lions map out their game plan. In slow-motion, we show you the final showdown between predator and prey. Will it be a successful hunt or will the hoofed animals persevere?

programme.title: White Lions: Born Wild
programme.sub-title: White Lions: Born Wild - Episode 1: Against all Odds
programme.desc: The two sisters are born as white as snow in May 2009 in South Africaâ€™s Kruger Park. Growing up in this vast, wild wilderness they must not only overcome the same survival challenges that all young lion cubs face, they must also overcome the threats their high visibility brings. In the African bush, anything unusual stands out and is often eliminated by eagle-eyed predators. Will our cubs survive? The odds are stacked against them â€“ 80 percent of all newborn lion cubs donâ€™t make it to adulthood.

programme.title: White Lions: Born Wild
programme.sub-title: White Lions: Born Wild - Episode 2: Fight for Survival
programme.desc: â€˜White Lions â€“ Born Wildâ€™ is a true wildlife story, with strong characters and closely studied behaviour. We follow the cubsâ€™ progress as they embark on the pathway to adulthood, learning to hunt, learning to avoid danger, learning to live in their white coats. This is a strong behaviour-led film, a coming-of-age story of a very rare and unusual pair of lions. Through their eyes, we learn what it is really like to be a lion in Africa.

programme.title: Under the Spell of Horses
programme.sub-title: Under the Spell of the Horses - Iceland
programme.desc: Iceland, the island of longing in the North. The biggest volcanic island in the world is known for its grandiose landscape, for its geysers and glaciers. But it is even more famous for its horses. Icelandic horses are considered the liveliest horses in the whole of Europe with the greatest stamina. They tÃ¶lt over mossy banks and lava rock unfazed by rivers, glaciers and scree slopes. In Nordic mythology the steed are never far behind the warriors. Where would Siefgried be without his horse Grani, or Odin without Sleipnir. Even the sun wouldnâ€™t rise or set if â€œawake earlyâ€ and â€œvery quickâ€ werenâ€™t pulling their chariot. From the beginning of colonisation, the Icelanders had the kind of close relationship with their horses usually only seen among the horse-riding peoples of Central Asia. And something of this love for horses still exists today. Life without horses would be unthinkable for Haukur Goroarsson, too. The 34-year old lives with his family in Vatnsdalur, a fertile valley in the North four hours by car from the capital city, Reykjavik. For him Icelandic horses are â€œa sort of Viking on four legsâ€. The settlement of this inhospitable island on the Arctic Circle would not have been possible without the animals. The stone deserts in the countryâ€™s interior are too vast to be crossed on foot.
